answers.answer: I have high blood pressure and baby has iugr, but haven't been diagnosed with preeclampsia, and have been put on modified bedrest meaning I can be up for a bit, but not long. I think it depends on the severity of your preeclampsia as to what actions the doctor takes.

I was told I had preeclampsia at 28 weeks. I had blurred vision, horrible headache not even pain medicine would take it away, high blood pressure. Didn't feel baby moving and my back hurt alot . I also got swollen from face, hands and feet so doctor had me in bedrest at hospital. I finally couldn't take it anymore I had really bad pain and my blood pressures were just getting worse. So I was induced at 30 weeks. Had my baby weighing 6 pds 4oz. After I gave birth I was fine everything was gone. With my baby at first I was told he was OK and would take him to me to breastfeed but instead the doc told me he had apnea. So he stayed in the NICU for like 2 weeks, he is now 2 and healthy.  Sorry its long.

question: Has anyone had or have preeclampsia ?What did they do to you once they found out? Did you need to stop working?  Were you put on bedrest? Did your diet change?
title: preeclampsia
